attributes.action: Award a posthumous knighthood to former Liverpool FC manager Bob Paisley in recognition of the fact that he should have achieved this honour during his lifetime both for his services to football, and the people of  Liverpool at large.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Bob Paisley MBE is not only the most succesful manager that Liverpool FC has ever had, he is also the most succesful manager that English football has ever had, as his list of honours below bares testament to.

Honours:  6 LEAGUE CHAMPIONSHIPS 1975-76, 1976-77, 1978-79, 1979-80, 1981-82, 1982-83
3 EUROPEAN CUPS 1976-77, 1977-78, 1980-81
3 LEAGUE CUPS 1980-81, 1981-82, 1982-83
1 UEFA CUP 1975-76
1 EUROPEAN SUPER CUP 1976-77
5 CHARITY SHIELDS 1974, 1976, 1977 (shared), 1980, 1982
6 MANAGER OF THE YEAR AWARDS 1975-76, 1976-77, 1978-79, 1979-80, 1981-82, 1982-83

During his lifetime Bob Paisley, through his footballing work, did an immense amount to raise the profile of Liverpool not only as a club but also as a city.

Of the several people who have so far recieved knighthoods for their footballing achievements none of them reached a level of achievement that could be compared to those of Mr Paisley.

rejection.details:
The honours system is entirely separate to the petitions mechanism, please use:
http://www.honours.gov.uk
reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
